meanings.definition: Make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse.
meanings.sent1: Her constant complaints only ended up acerbating the situation.
meanings.sent2: Adding fuel to the fire, his harsh words acerbated the tension in the room.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leaky faucet ended up acerbating the problem even more.
meanings.sent4: The misunderstanding between them was like a spark that acerbated into a blazing fire.
meanings.sent5: The negative feedback from the critics acerbated her self-doubt to unbearable levels.

meanings.sent1: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was acerbating her to the point of frustration.
meanings.sent2: His teasing remarks never failed to acerbate his little sister.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy had a way of acerbating the older dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The persistent sales calls acerbated him so much that he finally blocked the number.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet acerbated his annoyance throughout the night.
